Good morning,

Beginning March 16, meals for Norton City Schools students will be provided during the two-week closure period. The pick-up site for meals, for all students (the student must be present), will be John I. Burton Cafeteria. Meals will also be delivered by buses using our current routes. Breakfast will be available from 9-10:30 AM and Lunch will be available noon -1:30 PM. The bus drivers will start their breakfast route at 9 AM and the lunch route at noon. In order to help our cafeteria and transportation staff plan for preparation and delivery, please complete the survey that has been added to the District website under the COVID-19 updates section or call your school for more information on Monday, March 16. We are pleased to be able to offer this service to our students during this time.

Thank you,
Dr. Gina

The Norton City School Board is aware that members of the Norton community remain interested in and concerned about both the personnel action taken by the Board on Monday night and various comments made during the Public Comment portion of the Board meeting. The Board is aware that many members of the community are continuing to express concerns, predominantly through social media, about student safety and well-being.

The Board and school administration remain fully committed to providing our students with a safe and nurturing learning environment. Because of the need to protect student confidentiality and employee privacy, and because of other legal constraints, the Board and administration cannot discuss the details of student and personnel matters and investigations. The Board wishes to assure the community, however, that complaints involving any employee of the school division, whenever made and when detailed to school administrators, are taken seriously and will be investigated thoroughly.
